website_summaries.verdict: A quality black-and-white printer with color scanner. Offers outstanding value for the money.
pros: Fast and flexible monochrome printer for home and office use
cons: Poor instructions can make setup frustrating

website_summaries.verdict: This printer/scanner/copier/fax machine does it all with sharp text and good speed. It's a great choice for a home office.
pros: The right combination of speed and multiple functions make it perfect for the home office
cons: Some users have trouble with wireless connectivity

customer_reviews.title: I normally love Brother products but on this particular model
customer_reviews.text: Money Scamming Machine. I normally love Brother products but on this particular model, they FORCE you to replace the toner when it says it is low, when you CLEARLY have tons more printing that can be done from it. Once it give you the warning, it flat out refuses to print and will only do so once your replace the toner. Will not be buying any more Brother products from now on.
customer_reviews.author: G. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Only use expensive Brother toners, unless you want endless pop ups ALL DAY like it's insane!
customer_reviews.text: Don't get this printer unless you only use Brother toners. It is programmed to 'not play nice' with generic toners, giving all sorts of pop ups and errors, telling you about a hundred times a day to purchase genuine Brother toner. Yeah, in a busy office that's like another car payment! We're going back to our very forgiving Samsung printer, which uses any toner you can throw at it. This Brother goes to the store room as a back up, or maybe the janitor can sell it for gas money.
customer_reviews.author: Nath

customer_reviews.title: Wireless needs some work
customer_reviews.text: Nothing but problems with wireless printing and scanning: - Printer regularly goes into deep sleep where Google cloud print and AirPrint no longer function - Scanning over WiFi spontaneously fails, especially with higher-res scans. This is especially annoying when half-way through scanning a large document. Update September 2017: WiFi has gotten even worse than before. For the last few months I have to cycle the printer immediately prior to printing for my computer to establish a connection. Without fail, the connection drops again within a few minutes of powering on the printer.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: It's like a teenager, it takes 1/2 and hour to wake up!
customer_reviews.text: I tried to like this printer, but i had to return it. Did firmware update, connected via hardwire lan connection, found a way to turn off the deep sleep, everything, still when it didn't print for a while it would take between 20 seconds and 1/2 hour to print something. That it totally unacceptable considering my Brother 2270DW wakes up and prints in less than 5 SECONDS!. So I bought a drum and toner for it and am going back to it. Good thing I didn't throw the 2270DW away.
customer_reviews.author: Maina

customer_reviews.title: Beware of the catch -Will FORCE you to replace the toner when the print quality is still good
customer_reviews.text: I have the same complain as several others mentioned. Once the toner reaches a certain level, this printer will stop printing, while the print quality is perfectly fine and it could still print more. It will NOT allow you to print until the toner is replaced. This is a dirty trick to make you buy new toners quite often. If you think that the print quality will indicate the toner quality (as in most other brands) and the printer will continue to print, you will be disappointed when printer stops in the middle of some important printing.
customer_reviews.author: Nivethan

customer_reviews.title: If Brother is so reliable, why not help a customer when an "rare issue" occurs?
customer_reviews.text: Printer completely stopped printing after a year and a half. Factory reset, re-installed all drivers twice, wireless and wired connections, nothing worked. Brother customer service employee told me that they hadn't heard of this happening before, but only gave me the number of a far-away Authorized Service Center and said I had to pay to have it looked at and repaired myself, or buy a new printer. Had heard that Brother printers were supposed to be reliable. Guess not. Will not be buying another Brother product again.
customer_reviews.author: GERARD  D CHECCHIA

customer_reviews.title: So far so good, would have given it 5 but I've only ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, would have given it 5 but I've only owned for a day. Set up was a breeze. I highly recommend setting up wired and wireless connection with the printer USB cable(not included) connected from printer to Pc to ensure a smooth installation. Once complete, you don't need the wired connection. I also downloaded the brother app on my android.. works great! The printing is fast as advertised. ** during the end of the installation, you'll be asked if you want to set up fax also. I said yes even though I have no land line. I plan on adding later so I can fax from home. Wonderful printer!
customer_reviews.author: Karieem Wilcox

customer_reviews.title: I reset my toner counter
customer_reviews.text: The printer has worked great for my needs (print, scan, copy). I followed these steps to reset the cartridge counter and I was able to print. THE STEPS TO RESET YOUR BROTHER MFC-L2710DW TONER CARTRIDGE Open front door of printer (to reveal the cartridge mechanism) and “Front Door Open” will flash on the monitor. Good. Next, press STOP/EXIT and CLEAR at the SAME TIME(quick press) Immediately after, press CLEAR once again. A menu called RESET MENU will appear. Click the DOWN ARROW until you see TNR-STD Click OKAY Click UP ARROW To Confirm the reset.
customer_reviews.author: D.Car

customer_reviews.title: Brother MFCL2710DW with Mac works Great!
customer_reviews.text: The Brother MFCL2710DW was purchased to replace an inkjet printer which constantly failed to print. After unpacking and loading the toner cartridge and paper into the printer, my Apple Mac added the printer to the printer section automatically. I selected a letter sized print job no problem. I then loaded legal sized per instructions, and printed with no problem. Print quality is great. Quite a relief after suffering with an inkjet printer. I may miss color, but photos are better printed at kiosks anyway. I definitely recommend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Bob@Kaylahaus

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This Brother printer replaces my earlier-model MFCL 2710-DW (which has been totally reliable but which finally wore out). I couldn't hire anyone to do this installation because of the Covid-19 stay-in-place order, so I attempted to install it myself. NO PROBLEM! I'm an 85-year old female who knows nothing about computers, but I quickly got it up and running wirelessly from my laptop by using the installation disk. Just download the disk and follow the directions. It found my wi-fi and now works as well as my earlier, professionally-installed printer. I loved my prior Brother MFCL 2710-DW and I love this replacement too.
customer_reviews.author: 80goingon18

customer_reviews.title: This printer will make you appreciate that scene in "Office Space" with an entirely new clarity
customer_reviews.text: Followed all instructions to install on my network, worked fine for one day, and then it would go into "deep sleep" and no commands to print will wake it up. It will randomly wake up and print choice bits of any jobs sent to it during it's hibernation, but no way to predict which bits or when. Turning it off and on again didn't help, reinstalling all drivers and programs didn't help. Just packed it up to return it, but wish someone would make a reliable printer so I could print the darn return label.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money unless you like stress.
customer_reviews.text: This lasted me two years or rarely using it. The WLAN issues. The deep sleep issues. I am plugging my laptop directly into the printer and it is completely refusing the acknowledge the presence of the USB. With how little I have used this printer(particularly because it grew harder and harder to use over time), I am really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sheena

customer_reviews.title: ok printer, requires premature replacement of expensive toner
customer_reviews.text: Printer is ok, but they have programmed it to stop printing at a certain point - goes from printing fine to error message of "replace toner". Not a fan of these strategies to force a purchase of toner earlier than is absolutely necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Scanning options are ridiculous; customer service is ignorant
customer_reviews.text: From my computer, I can scan to a searchable PDF. From the printer, I can save to a non-searchable PDF or a searchable .txt, but not PDF. That's ridiculous. Because the printer is in a different room from the computer, to scan from the computer would require a trip to load the document, then back to the computer to scan, then back to the printer to get the document. Insane! Then, when I called support, they took me through an hour of doing different things to get it to do what I wanted, before I insisted on a supervisor who informed me it can't be done. An hour wasted.
customer_reviews.author: ArchaeologywithacapitalS

customer_reviews.title: Printer is fine once you get past the issue where it enters ...
customer_reviews.text: Printer is fine once you get past the issue where it enters deep sleep and does not receive print jobs at all! A printer should not have this issue! I discovered how to fix this by reading another amazon review whereby the technician helping the reviewer told him to toggle (inverse) the IPv6 setting on the printer from the web interface. I do not give the printer an IPv6 address, so it is not being used, however toggling this option fixed the deep sleep breaking my printer's usefulness issue. I even went and toggled IPv6 yet again so that it was back to the original state of "off", yet the deep sleep issue is resolved.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Beckwith III

customer_reviews.title: Sleep> Deep Sleep> Coma> Brain Dead
customer_reviews.text: Bought this machine to replace an older Brother model that wore out. 3 days later it would not awake from deep sleep. Tried everything in the comments and the user groups. Had a senior systems engineer check it out. Can't overcome the problem, caused by a faulty design: the device in the printer can't be reached by the router which has changed the address dynamically as all home routers do, so it can't get the wakeup call. Finally got disgusted on 29th day and sent it back. Too bad - brother used to have the best reputation in the printer industry. DON'T BUY THIS MACHINE UNLESS YOU CRAVE MISERY.
customer_reviews.author: ozzie klein

customer_reviews.title: Great monochrome laser printer at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great monochrome laser printer. It has all the great features including double sided printing and scanning capability (automatic) with faxing ability only lacking color printing capability but is priced very reasonable regardless. Brother products are great and this isn't an exception. I was considering perhaps buying a modern inkjet type printer when my main brother mfc 9325cw developed a problem but settled on this after researching ink prices can you say "EXTORTION" nope stick with Laser Toner like these Brother printers you'll be glad you did.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Stupak

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what I need!
customer_reviews.text: THE NEED: A black and white MFC that could print/copy/fax large volumes of paper QUICKLY. OUTCOME: EXPONENTIALLY faster than my inkjet. I use an inkjet with tanks of ink for color printing but for black and white print jobs, high volume, labels, envelopes, etc, I used this bad boy. You can't go wrong for the money. PROS: Serves my need and works reliably well. 3rd party toner works well and is way less expensive than Brother toner. Working with this toner ( CONS: It's a bit of cheap build quality but for this kind of money who cares!! We used to pay around $2,000 for a simple printer that was slower than this in the "old days"
customer_reviews.author: A. Francis

customer_reviews.title: This was a great Printer until it died
customer_reviews.text: This printer was lightly used (still 80% life of the original toner) but on day 495 it broke. The error message is "Scan Unable AF" and it makes a horrible grinding sound. Call it a death rattle. This was 4 months after the warranty expired. I reached out to Brother but they could only suggested taking it to a service center. Of course, there are none nearby. I am very disappointed in the quality of this product. This was my 4th Brother printer. The oldest, which still works I bought in 2006.
customer_reviews.author: D. Cox

customer_reviews.title: Does what its meant to do
customer_reviews.text: I have been through 4 printers in the past four years. The main reason I purchased them were for school projects and somehow after a few times those printers were used the ink will not be good or the printer won't connect to the wifi or some other bull****. This printer is dope, it prints fast, its easy to set up, took me less than 5 mins to set it up on the table, install the ink and connect it to the Wifi. It looks bulky and heavy, but it is very light weight. Works well with my windows/MacBook/iPhone/Android devices. This printer is also great for any small business that needs to print shipping labels/invoices.
customer_reviews.author: Luis P.

customer_reviews.title: Ditch your inkjet! Fast, economical, easy to use, best software out there and I have tried many brands
customer_reviews.text: Such a great printer! Very user friendly, but above all the software that brother provides is excellent, far better than competing brands and it's a feature nobody really thinks about. It prints quickly and efficiently with excellent text resolution and very good image rendering. I have used it both with ethernet and wifi, works perfectly on both accounts with easily managed printing presets. Interfaces smoothly with windows apps. You can also scan and share files directly to cloud servers! I can file paper invoices in excellent resolution on a pdf straight to my cloud server!
customer_reviews.author: Juan Suarez

customer_reviews.title: Wi-Fi connection problems time after time after time...
customer_reviews.text: Have had multiple Wi-Fi connection problems over the last year. Can never seem to do a quick print without having to get into trouble shooting mode. If you're looking for a easy push one button printer, better look elsewhere! Funny (not really) how all my other devices, TV, laptop, iPad, iPhone all connect to the Wi-Fi router without any issues everytime...
customer_reviews.author: Alan T

customer_reviews.title: JUNK-- won't stay connected to Wifi
customer_reviews.text: OK, I bought this printer because it was supposed to be WiFi enabled...and it does print well from my phone. However, EVERY.SINGLE.TIME I need to print from my PC or laptop (which is almost daily), I have to go through the WHOLE printer setup process...inserting the setup disc, enabling wifi from the printer, finding my wifi network, entering my password, etc, etc, etc...The printer and my modem and router are literally less than 10' apart in the same small room.....JUNK. Wish I could return it but I'm past the return window. I'm ONLY giving it 2 stars because it does print well from my phone. Looks like I may have to hardwire the computer to the printer. NOT HAPPY.
customer_reviews.author: CareyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: What you save buying the printer, you'll spend on toner
customer_reviews.text: This printer is NOT compatible with any of the generic toner, even if the toner says it's compatible. Brother switched the chips in their printers so the only toner that can be used is Brother toner. High-yield toner for this printer is $75 (and from the reviews on that, it sounds like you'll only get a fraction of the prints that are advertised). You're going to end up paying a TON with printing. As far as the printer itself, the printing is crisp, the copying is ok (photo came out grainy and not the quality of the original), and it scans just fine. If you're looking for a cost-effective printer, do NOT get this printer!
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Cordova

customer_reviews.title: Same as older models
customer_reviews.text: I've had a Brother all in one for years. This one looks just like my old one..so easy to understand functions. This one does sometimes drag my paper, on the feeder to copy, crooked. There just doesn't seem to be any improvements over the older version. It works alright..I just assumed it would copy and print faster. My old Brother lasted for years so for the money, this one is great!
customer_reviews.author: Glenda T Hodge

customer_reviews.title: What a great Machine!
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to do simple copies but could also print from my computer. I'm here to tell you that I ordered this in a huge hurry and didn't even realize that it was a fax too. Out of the box setup and printing within 10 minutes! Pushed a button on the machine and a button on my Cox router and it was an instant (almost) wifi printer that all of us have hooked up to. Best printer I have ever bought, hands-down.
customer_reviews.author: John Derossett

customer_reviews.title: Printing envelopes a nightmare!!
customer_reviews.text: If you're planning to print envelopes with this printer then I suggest you pick a different model. Here are the steps needed to print a single envelope: 1. Turn the printer around so you can access the back; 2. Open the back tray door and find two green tabs; 3. Flip both green tabs downwards; 4. Turn the printer to the front and open the manual paper tray; 5. Adjust the guides and insert your envelope; 6. Print the envelope; 7. Reverse steps 2 & 3. Complete stupidity on whoever came up with this idea!
customer_reviews.author: Luigi

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Printer
customer_reviews.text: I'm surprised how much I'm enjoying this printer, which I purchased after realizing how little ink is in an Ink-jet printer cartridge, and how expensive they were getting. It's very quiet, and after over a month I'm still on the initial cartridge, though I've been printing out a lot of letters for a fundraising campaign for a non-profit entity. I also like the automatic double sided printing, which is fast too. Thus far I've printed, copied, and scanned and all have worked very well. I still have a couple of ink jet units, for occasional color, and for my small business, but don't think I'll be using them much.
customer_reviews.author: Sue M

customer_reviews.title: WORKS FINE! REPLACES A SIMILAR OLDER MODEL
customer_reviews.text: No more ink cartridges! Toner for me! I had so many dried up ink cartridges, because I rarely printed anything. Frequently scanned; and occasionally faxed. This is the right choice! Easy to use. My only complaint is that it is always 'on'. The old one turned off and was off; this new one is on stand-by. I connected it to a power strip with a switch on it, so I could turn it off & it would be off. Easy to load legal sized paper (one sheet at a time). One very attractive feature is that it prints on both sides of the paper, without the need to manually re-insert it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff A. Deskins

customer_reviews.title: Good printer, terrible Wifi setup process
customer_reviews.text: For those of us spoiled by easy-to-use, plug-in-play technology, you'll hate the Wifi set up on this printer. What a pain! The instructions are awful as well. I learned how to set it up by reading the comments from other people here. In the Menu, go to Network (6), select WLAN, and then the Setup Wizard. Much easier that way. One thing to keep in mind when you have to change networks: you'll need to reset the Network and start again (letting it search for the SSID). Otherwise, you'll be stuck in a frustrating loop of it not connecting and not letting you select the network or enter the password.
customer_reviews.author: purplekarma1970

customer_reviews.title: Brother replaced one for me, replacement stopped working too.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if these printer "errors" are programmed for failure or what, but both of these printers failed on me with the same error. 'Print Unable 05' The printer will show you this error and ask you to restart a few times etc. It is then never able to print again. Now Amazon shows that the printer is no longer eligible for service so .... are we suppose to buy a new printer every few months ?
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Equipment failure
customer_reviews.text: Printer failed 1 year and 2 months after purchase. After a recent loss of power the printer the printer reports an error ZC. Evidently this is a failure of the power circuitry that requires a hardware fix. The cost of this exceeds the current value of the printer. The printer was otherwise a reliable machine. The printer was intended to replace inkjet printers which required ever increasing amounts of ink. Now I may have to return to inkjet. Ultimately this was a failed experiment in cost savings and reliability. Search results suggest this is not an uncommon error but it has no common fix. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Hutton

customer_reviews.title: Cheap printer/scanner that proves you get what you pay for with some tech.
customer_reviews.text: Scans well, prints well. The hassles come into play when you share this device among multiple computers. The best thing to do is to install the suite of software from the disk directly to each box. The other solutions are less effective. Tech Support for the printer is AWFUL. Brother will not even let you buy parts directly from them to fix the printer if you have an issue and instead you must pay for the marked up parts via one of their repair vendors, the cost of which is more than it would be to buy a completely refurbished printer!!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon D Leszczynski

customer_reviews.title: Printer ok, cartridges terribly expensive - not worth buying this printer
customer_reviews.text: I had several brother all-in-one printers, and we decided without further research to buy another Brother. What a mistake! The printers we had in the past lasted a minimum of 1 year for $80-90/cartridge. With this printer you get about 2200 pager (not 3000 as advertised) for $80. That comes to about 4 cents per page, which is ridiculously expensive for a quality laser printer. After all, for double that money you can print at Staples or Kinko's. I will never again buy a brother laser printer. Printer is decent, but cartridges have an extremely low value when compared to price.
customer_reviews.author: G. Enescu

customer_reviews.title: Useless except maybe a toxic boat anchor
customer_reviews.text: Initially I liked it so much we bought a second one. Alas I've had to toss both one less than a year old. I can only assume it's an over aggressive attempt to stop users from buying third party toners but for the last month both printers have randomly locked up with a "check drum" error. Sometimes the error goes away with a toner replacement sometimes it takes a new drum. I've decided to toss them because the drum replacements are coming at twice the rate of toner replacements. Junk!
customer_reviews.author: just one more customer

customer_reviews.title: I ordered the MFCL2700DW due to the relatively good reviews on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the MFCL2700DW due to the relatively good reviews on Amazon. The first unit had awful print quality. Images had horizontal lines running through them. After ordering a replacement from Amazon, the second unit suffered from the same print quality issue (to a lesser degree), and also had trouble staying connected to the Wi-fi network. I can understand one unit being bad, but receiving 2 bad units in 2 tries implies a bad product. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Erin L.

customer_reviews.title: absolutely maddening that i cannot print.... ...
customer_reviews.text: absolutely maddening that i cannot print.... will not come out of sleep mode no matter what i do... i have been through various forums to fix this and it still wont print
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Hess

customer_reviews.title: Not for Macintosh users!
customer_reviews.text: I got this printer to use as a wifi scanner with my MacBook Pro. Instructions are opaque and refer only to Windows operating systems. Everything needed to operate is accessed through a small *unlit* screen; it is difficult to read even with excellent room lighting. It would be helpful if a schematic disclosed the full contents of operational menu, but the instructions booklet contains nothing of the kind. I don't give up easily, but, after too many frustrating hours, I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas G. Field, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Good printer
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty standard printer with both wired and wifi capabilities. Keep in mind that the printer needs to be connected to a network to access scan functions, but for a novice that should be easy. It comes with the necessary setup programs to get started. This is not the kind of printer where you will be buying $20 ink cartridges for. Ink is about $44, and you also need to replace the drum on occasion, which is usually pretty cheap and easy to do. This also a black and white only printer, no color cartridges needed.
customer_reviews.author: Lee A. Coffin

customer_reviews.title: It's the one to buy.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned three of these. They're the best value for your money on the market and offer everything you need to have an office at home. Wireless printing is a big plus too. Also, I learned not to buy aftermarket toner cartridges -they didn't print perfectly for me; but the large-sized Brother cartridge lasts a few years of home use and prints nice solids. The imaging drum is even replaceable on this machine, so if you have it for a decade and wear down a drum, your can restore the machine to like-new printing by sliding in a new drum.
customer_reviews.author: Restoration Hobbyist

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Update: I’ve had this printer almost a year now and I still hate it with every fiber of my being. Seen the movie Office Space? That’s about to happen to this piece of crap! I’ve had this printer for 3 months now. It worked great right at first and, like other reviewers stated, it now goes into a deep sleep. I can’t wake it up! I’ve unplugged it, pressed all the buttons in numerous patterns, and yelled at it many times. I paid way to much for this to end up with a paperweight. Biggest waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Harpy

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, great print quality, prints both sides, ink last much longer than inkjet.
customer_reviews.text: I had a Brother Laser all-in-one for many years and when it started paper jamming, I bought an inkjet. Regretfully, those are nothing but trouble, at least the two from HP that I ended up throwing away after a short service. So I went back to Brother black and white laser, found this delightful and inexpensive model. Flawless, almost a year old by now. Powder cartridge lasts a long time, many time longer then the inkjet cartridge. Prints automatically both sides of paper which is great, but does not scan both sides. They probably have the same looking product that scans both sides for more money if that is important to you.
customer_reviews.author: Hawk Eye

customer_reviews.title: Nice black and white printer
customer_reviews.text: A very nice laser printer. Black and White only but I usually don't need color. It does scan in color. It's fairly fast and prints on both side to save paper. It comes with a driver CD disk but for some reason to be able to scan you have download an App from the net. I had to call in about this and the Brother help line was very good about the set up. For wireless set up it is easier if you have USB printer cable hooked up for the initial set up. After that you don't need it.
customer_reviews.author: Lorensd1

customer_reviews.title: Replaced and still breaking down
customer_reviews.text: The first one we purchased stopped working within a month so it was replaced. Since then we've had nothing but problems. We did what Brother suggested: we replaced the drum, the roller, tried multiple ink companies (even the very expensive Brother ink) and nothing changed. By the way, we paid for all these "fixes" as Brother would not. This was a waste of money and I cannot recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: InPinkClover

customer_reviews.title: Buying new ink was like buying a new printer
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of getting ripped off with ink prices on HP inkjet printers. I just needed to make an occasional copy for home use. Every time I turned around the Inkjet printer was out. Buying new ink was like buying a new printer. This laser jet model makes great copies and is very quiet. After several months, I’m extremely pleased. The included toner will make hundreds of copies.
customer_reviews.author: Lane

customer_reviews.title: PRINTER DOES ACCEPT GENERIC TONER CARTRIDGES
customer_reviews.text: Some of the reviews of this printer on the Amazon website are not accurate -- this printer DOES accept GENERIC cartridges. You are not limited to expensive toner cartridges made by Brother. However, I have other issues with the printer. I ordered two different printers. Both had a shoddy print quality, and created dark lines along the side of the printed page. I ended up having to throw away the second printer after 35 days of use -- just after the "return window" expired on Amazon. I replaced the second printer with a third printer. That one seems to be working fine, after a couple of days.
customer_reviews.author: Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Great printing. No "inkjet" clogging problems. Nice "iBrother" phone app. But not perfect. LCD and Wifi issues.
customer_reviews.text: I got this printer after hating how trash inkjet printers are. Laser printers are larger, but I can get so many pages out of on toner cartridge, and very quickly too. The iBrother app is super handy for your phone and use it a lot. This could be a 5 star product if it weren't for two problems. 1) The LCD panel is too faint. I've seen dollar calculators with a better LCD display. Adjusting contrast just makes the whole screen darker, not really more legible. 2). Wifi connection drops constantly. It has the SSID stored, but I've had to re-enter the same credentials time and time again. Seems that other people have this issue too.
customer_reviews.author: Ali Al-Hassani

customer_reviews.title: Terrible installation instructions.  Toner ripoff, warrenty ripoff
customer_reviews.text: Took a very experienced tech over an hour to set up. Ink cartridge that came with the printer prints only 700 pages! You can't buy a 700 page cartridge --it only comes with a new printer and is just another example of being #^^%$$#$ over by another Corporate scammer. The smallest cartridge for purchase is 1200 pages, why not ship the printer with this cartridge?? I've had Brother printers for over a decade and this experience destroyed any confidence I had with the brand. No cash refund for this printer, they only send a replacement which may be 'remanufactured' Why would I want another defective machine?
customer_reviews.author: Richard R. Sadler

customer_reviews.title: Regular Problems
customer_reviews.text: I've experienced daily problems with this product since I plugged it in. I have a small office and this was about the fifth Brother printer I have purchased. In the past, these printers have performed well and without regular maintenance for errors. However, this printer has required daily maintenance for errors regarding faxing and scanning. I would not purchase this printer again and would not recommend this model.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Not COMPATIBLE WITH MAC MOJAVE
customer_reviews.text: Not exactly sure what the issue was but after 4 months the scanner completely stopped working and scanned everything in zebra print. They said it was a software issue with Mac Mojave. Spent multiple hours on the phone with customer support. I was left hanging even though my scanner was still under warranty. They kept putting me off and said they would escalate my issue. Never seemed to be escalated. Unfortunate experience. Will no longer use Brother.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ann

customer_reviews.title: I would not buy this printer again. I purchased ...
customer_reviews.text: I would not buy this printer again. I purchased it in April and have had to replace the toner every single month since purchase. I now have to replace the drum already. We do a fair amount of printing but nothing that would warrant replacing the toner every month. I replaced another Brother printer that was discontinued very similar to this one. We went 6 months before replacing toner on that one! I have spoken with Brother and they walked me through how to change the "life" of the toner. That did not work, and honestly shouldn't be something I should have to call in to do, there shouldn't be a way to do that on the machine itself.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke J Dokken

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: If I turn the power off on this printer and then back on, the printer losses it connectivity and turns out to be a NIGHTMARE to reconnect it. I started leaving the damn thing on, but we had a storm roll through and the power went out. I spent a while trying to get it to reconnect, but no luck. SCREW THIS PRINTER!!!!!! I am absolutely over this thing and Brother as a manufacturer! Oh well, time to throw this POS in the trash and go buy something better and with a more reputable name.
customer_reviews.author: William Booth

customer_reviews.title: Prints too light and can't adjust it for printing emails or web pages
customer_reviews.text: Spent HOURS on the phone with the warranty folks and the Brother tech support people to try to set a default print density setting because the Brother User guides online are poorly written and didn't really address this. Had to reload the drivers and then I could set density for documents, but not for anything else. The printer lets you set density on the actual printer for copies, scans, and faxes...but have to use computer to set print density for printing...only problem is that you can't set it for printing out emails or stuff off the web (like purchase receipts or tickets to events, etc). I should have stuck with HP.
customer_reviews.author: mcorio

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought it sooner
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had bought one of these years ago instead of wasting so much money on the ink jet printers! Absolutely perfect for me! I don't print on a regular basis so the ink jet cartridges would dry out and I'd have to go buy another cartridge to print 3 or 4 pages. This works great every time....no matter when the last time I printed was.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer to save money and make my life easier. Well I found out it is cheaper because it doesn't do everything. Apparently it is not easy to do double sided copies. Instead of inserting them in the document feeder like you would think, you have to scan and flip them on the bed. EVERY PAGE. I also had some envelopes I needed to address and that was a nightmare. My life is not easier. As of last night there is a black streak down the middle of my page if I copy or scan. I have never had this happen with any other printer I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Tyree

customer_reviews.title: Solid printer - great performance.
customer_reviews.text: My HP printers cost a lot in ink, had continual connectivity issues, and were a general disappointment - whether I purchased a higher end or a less expensive printer. Two friends recommending purchasing a Brother, so I reviewed their products and purchased this laser printer. Set up was a breeze, and I can print from my computer or phone (both Apple products). Print quality is excellent and printing is fast with the laser. Scanning is easy. I like the versatility of this machine. I decided not to get a color printer as I rarely need it. I'm very pleased with this product - especially as it is Apple friendly!
customer_reviews.author: Tangier14

customer_reviews.title: Works great! No more color ink cartridges!
customer_reviews.text: Love this printer as I don't have to replace color cartridges just to print black and white anymore! Most of the time I need black and white printing (grayscale). I don't do photos much. But other printers had used up color cartridges even when printing black and white. And I would have to replace expensive color cartridges just to be able to print in black. This printer solves the problem. Nice quality, works with wifi too, and does better print quality than my old inkjets. Easy to change toner cartridges, works well with those online cheapo inks too. Love it. I cannot print in color anymore but I never did that much anyway.
customer_reviews.author: GirlBerry

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer BUT not compatible with modern AFCI breakers!
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised when this came and immediately tripped the breaker. I sent it back and got another one. Same thing! In the end I had to install a regular (non-AFCI) breaker before I could get it to work. AFCI (arc-fault circuit interrupter) breakers are sensitive to current spikes that look like an arc and apparently, on-startup, this printer does something that looks like an arc! Apart from that, Brother quality and reliability has always been great and I expect it will be so again with this latest model that's replacing a 10 year old Brother laser.
customer_reviews.author: App

customer_reviews.title: Best printer for the money
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for about 1 year now. I use it a few times a week. It still has the original toner cartridge. I haven't had any problems with it in the year that I've owned it. One of the things I like the best about this device is; the time it takes to start printing, from the time I send the print job, is very fast. And the printer is coming out of sleep mode when I do that. So I really appreciate that. I think I only paid about $115 for this. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: John Brigan

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 3 years.. then died
customer_reviews.text: 3 years and I need a new one already. Out of the blue it started double copying. Large black streaks as well. I took it appart,cleaned it bought a new toner cartridge..nothing works... really surprised since I only print 2-5 things a month.. heck I'm still on my first ream of paper!
customer_reviews.author: Red Sky NYC

customer_reviews.title: In Use Less Than 1 Month
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer on 8/6 and it arrived in my home in less than a week. Today (8/31) it is broken. The toner cartridge will not be recognized. A portion of the sensor is broken off and I keep kitting a message "replace toner". I am waiting for a tech to call back.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Horizontal lines/streaks
customer_reviews.text: Horizontal lines/streaks. This happened with another Brother printer I had purchased elsewhere and I returned that one. On this one the lines/streaks aren't as noticeable but they are there. Please don't tell me to clean the drum unit. Been there, done that. I'm still debating whether to return or not. I still haven't tested the scanner/copier. This whole horizontal lines thing really gets to me since my last printer that was over 13 years old printed prettier than this even if it was at 6 pages per minute. I included pics. The last one is the actual image I printed from.
customer_reviews.author: R. G.

customer_reviews.title: We get a copy in 12 seconds from any sort of printer sleep level
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing so far. I just want something that will reliably make black and white copies of things when I want it to and this fits the bill. My HP color ink jet was so slow and annoying that I wanted to launch it into space, but so far so good with this copier. Pop something in there that I want to copy/print something from my computer (we run Ubuntu) and it spits out a copy from any sort of sleep in about 12 seconds. For printing it was plug and play on Ubuntu, and for scanning we had to install the Brother drivers from the Brother website. No problem at all.
customer_reviews.author: Lizard in the Air

customer_reviews.title: Junk Quality
customer_reviews.text: I sent the first one back because the paper was difficult to reach inside the machine after being printed and the envelopes were always crumpled. The second one is difficult to use for printing envelopes (saying there is a jam and to open the machine and remove the drum unit - then after reinserting the envelope the message repeats) and still leaves a crease on each envelope. I have had no problems using Brother products in the past. I presume I got 2 lemons. I will go back to HPs.
customer_reviews.author: brent  h. perkins

customer_reviews.title: Brother makes awesome printers. I have an older wireless model that's ...
customer_reviews.text: Brother makes awesome printers. I have an older wireless model that's been working without problem for over 10 years so I purchased this one for my mom. The wireless setup was a breeze compared to the older model I own and has no problem waking up from a sleep mode so not sure why so many people are complaining about having to redo the wireless setup. I have not been able to figure out the duplex printing but other than that no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa K

customer_reviews.title: Great printer, great price, happy customer
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a great price. Great printer, very rich features, at a very good price. result? Happy customer. Brother machines are super-reliable. This replaced a much bigger Brother color multifunction I have had for years. It was great, but I needed to get something lighter with a smaller footprint, and I found I did very little color printing. Very satisfied. Do not hesitate to buy this if you are looking for a black and white, duplex multifunction in the medium range.
customer_reviews.author: Bill C

customer_reviews.title: Fake One Star Reviews, Beware
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, functional, efficient printer/fax/scanner. It took me 2 minutes to set it up and connect to my wireless network. This is my second Brother laser printer. The other one still works after 7 years, I just wanted a wireless one. Toner is cheap, drum is cheap, the output is perfect. Nothing to complain about. I noticed there are loads of negative fake reviews on this printer. I hope people who just want a great printer see through these strange, repetitive fake reviews. Amazon needs to take action to determine the veracity of these fake one star reviews.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Workhorse at a great price
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd of these all in one printers I have purchased for the family. All are still functioning perfectly. If you do not need color it does everything you want at a reasonable cost. When scanning larger documents to PDF it yields a reasonable size file that can be emailed. Many of the cheap all in ones yield huge PDF files that are cumbersome to work with especially if you have to send a lot of information. Color documents can also be scanned to your PC or email. I have never had the need to access tech support. Yield on the toner cartridges is high.
customer_reviews.author: K. E. Swatt

customer_reviews.title: This product saves my life
customer_reviews.text: I had a ink printer before and it took about 1-2 minutes to print 1 page. I am so glad I decided to replace it with a laser printer after years of purchasing expensive new ink cartridges. The starter toner lasts for about 500-700 pages and the speed is amazing compared with my old printer. It took only 1-2 minutes for over 10 pages. It saved my life literally!
customer_reviews.author: AnnieRen

customer_reviews.title: Discontinued Model; My MFCL2700DW Died after 27 months
customer_reviews.text: Some reviewers refer to a chipped toner cartridge that forces the printer to not print after the chip deems the toner level too low. I've never had that issue, and used only Brother cartridges. The printer's been ok (it also can fax--who does THAT anymore???); a few weird things I could fix, but lately it's printing horizontal and vertical lines, and ghost toner. I've tried every possible fix (including brand-new toner, and cleaning the drum), to no avail. A new drum is as expensive as some new printers, so fuggedabowdit. Brother's website shows this model as discontinued, so beware. I wouldn't buy this if I'd known it was going to live for barely more than two years.
customer_reviews.author: I. Candy

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY WIRELESS DOES NOT WORK
customer_reviews.text: This is by far my worst purchase from amazon especially a brother product. DO NOT BUY THIS printer if you intend on hooking it up to WiFi and scanning documents. It does not work and tech support is non existent. I wish there was a zero star rating for this particular product. I am truly disappointed at the antiquated technology used and sold as a wireless device. This is a scam and a rip off again DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony T Galante

customer_reviews.title: machine woud't be so bad if it wasn't for tech / customer service
customer_reviews.text: The unit is as I write it is still under the manufacture's warranty - BUT!!! after 2.5 hrs on the phone with theirs customer service rep I gave up.... he had me going in circles trying to get this machine going even if it continued to flash - "Replace the toner" no matter what we did. Consequently, Brother's did not honor the warranty. Meanwhile, I purchased another unit - just like it - at Best Buy (our business must have a fax machine on 24/7) - it failed after just 3 weeks of use. If Brother's customer service (1-877-276-8437) reads it, the reference # to my case is 200217-002330
customer_reviews.author: mpk

customer_reviews.title: Good Printer
customer_reviews.text: Good feature rich, low priced, printer. Duplex printing is a nice touch (does not have duplex scanning). Relatively inexpensive toner. Envelope /label/front feeder is a better system then of MFC's past - paper feeds straight. Set up went well in Win 10 Pro and 10 Home. Android App works slow on my phone but generally does well, some neat features. We have had brother MFC's for about 13 years and have had very little issues with the units. Looked at other brother MFC's (like color units that will do duplex scanning) and settled on this for the ratings and money. Color would be really nice for some situations but overall we are monotone users (code for boring dinner guests).
customer_reviews.author: Ted Schulz

customer_reviews.title: Printing from the computer has been fine, but using it with my wireless devices has ...
customer_reviews.text: This printer has been a pain to set up. Printing from the computer has been fine, but using it with my wireless devices has been total frustration. It will not stay connected to the mobile devices for more than one print and then it is gone. I have called time and time again and they set it up differently every time. I thought we had it the last time. It printed three things and then gone again. Would send it back, but threw the box away.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Bad Customer Support!!!
customer_reviews.text: I like the printer, but I bought it new on Amazon and it claimed that I could print 3000 pages with the toner cartridge. After less than 50 jobs, the quality starting getting bad and I started getting a toner low warning. I called Amazon support, who connected me with Brother support. Brother support was horrible. The rep read me some tedious script about toner cartridges and was giving me the runaround. After about an hour, I got a supervisor who solved my problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Will no longer Scan, will not reset connection
customer_reviews.text: I have had this printer for a little over a year. A month ago it stopped connecting to my computer and I couldn't scan. I have tried everything reset, hard wire to modem to reset the wireless, tried via wi-fi to reset the connection, and reloaded the drivers. I have seen a few other reviews that stated this but I bought it anyway. Now I wish I hadn't. It is a great printer, but there are cheaper options if you just want a printer.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Value & Quality (quick fix for deep sleep)
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly and in perfect condition with superb original packaging from manufacturer. This printer does it all and replacement toner is reasonably priced. I knew about the deep sleep mode issue from previous reviews so the quick fix is to simply set the sleep time to zero. Here are the steps: 1) press menu, 2) press general setup, 3) scroll down to Ecology and press ok, 4) scroll down to sleep time and press ok, 5) enter 0. Display should say accepted. I would give 5 stars if the deep sleep mode was turned off by default. Highly recommend for small business use.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, easy to set up, even Brother's WiFi setup is better. Just be aware the some people, mostly old people that are stuck in the 80s and 90s and want FAX, soooo, if your are buying this printer for GEEZERS and relying on a technology that was invented in the 60s, make sure it has FAXING capabilities so as not to upset these fragile older idiots.
customer_reviews.author: Computer Pros of Malibu

customer_reviews.title: Great wifi printer
customer_reviews.text: Great wifi printer. The envelope printing design and utilization is cumbersome. It requires flipping a door on the back and then flipping two tabs that are then exposed on the back. If you place the printer on a stand which gives the user walk around access it might be acceptable. Placing it on a desk which is against a wall makes printing envelopes a challenge.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cook

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, great print quality
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to setup with the included disk. Had no problems connecting to my in home wifi wirelessly. Printed flawlessly. Also downloaded the Android Brother Iprint app. Tested it. Worked great! UPDATE: A month later and it is still working flawlessly. I tried the scan function today from the Brother Iprint app. Perfection. It's not very loud, doesn't take up a lot of space, is sleek & attractive, and has not gone offline once. I print may once per week. Everyone I send something to it, immediately wakes up and prints/scans.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy one!!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one of these printers. Printed 30 copies and then got the message that the toner was empty, so nothing more would print. Ordered new toner cartridge, at over $90.00!! Didn't work. Returned printer, got a new one. My computer won't recognize the new one. Now I have been without a printer for about 3 weeks!! Buy your printer locally, or don't get a Brother!
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: sold me a discontinued item
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this last August! I have struggled with it since. It will not stay on line. Shortly after the purchase, I had a tech come and take a look at it. He told me was it discontinued printer and yet Amazon sold it to me. I was instructed on to get it back on line. But I have to go through this procedure several times. I cannot keep going through this. Why sell discontinued items, without the customers knowledge? I would simply like to have this replaced. invoice dated 8/2017... Brother MFCL2700 DW, compact laser, all in one printer... Thanks for your attention.. Lois West, a loyal customer
customer_reviews.author: Lois West

customer_reviews.title: Meh. It works but no bells or whistles.
customer_reviews.text: A REAL PIECE OF JUNK. DO NOT BUY THIS PRINTER. HAVE USED IT 3 MONTHS. WORST FEATURE? REQUIRES EXPENSIVE NEW INK CARTRIDGE AFTER MINIMAL USE. AVERAGES ABOUT ONE CARTRIDGE REPLACEMENT PER MONTH!!! SLOW TO PRINT & SEND AND RECEIVE FAXES. ANY TIME YOU PRINT OVER 10 COPIES AT ONE TIME, YOU MUST STAND AT MACHINE TO CATCH COPIES AS THEY PRINT. I LOVE AMAZON AND RARELY WRITE NEGATIVE REVIEWS. BROTHER SHOULD BE ASHAMED OF THIS PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: Lizzi

customer_reviews.title: No ability to reset low toner message
customer_reviews.text: The older model was great. Whenever it said "replace toner," I used to do the old open cover, clear, asterisk, double zero method of getting more print out of each cartridge. This code doesn't work on this model, nor do any other codes. And there's no warning of it either. One day the printer works, the next day its says the toner is low then stops working entirely, even when it was printing fine. This is likely Brother's way of forcing you to buy a new toner cartridge, and more of them. But what it means to me is that it's the last time I buy a Brother printer.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Remember to set 'low toner' alert to CONTINUE and it works great!
customer_reviews.text: This has been working wonderfully for us. My only complaint is that non OEM toner cartridges are totally IGNORED by the printer toner-level-status alert mechanism - telling the user that the toner is empty, even with a new one inserted - but I knew about this in advance, so I just went into the settings and told the printer to CONTINUE when the 'low toner' signal is received - annoying, but easily ignored!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Hartig

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time
customer_reviews.text: Horrible printer! Faxes with lines constantly and the print quality of scanned documents is so bad I have to buy a new mfc printer. I tried to return this, but missed the deadline by a few days. Brother has been worthless as far as troubleshooting.
customer_reviews.author: A. VanWagenen

customer_reviews.title: Prints Fine When the Wireless Connection Works
customer_reviews.text: The wireless connection is subject to disconnect without provocation. Last month, I had at least two days a week that the wireless printing did not work! I have an HP inkjet wireless printer on the same shelf that is connected to the same wireless network with no problems. As a matter of fact, it is this HP printer that I end up printing to wirelessly when the Brother Laser printer stops working. Even though I bought this when it was on sale, I would not buy this model again. It is too expensive to have this many issues with the wireless connection.
customer_reviews.author: Tra

customer_reviews.title: Great copier- mediocre wireless printing speed.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good workhorse. Copies are crisp and fast. It is easy to copy from one sided to two sided. I copy lots of worksheets for my students and the cost of ink and ease of use is perfect for me. My only issue is printing via the printer's own wireless network from my phone is painfully slow. I don't have internet. I have to plan ahead a few minutes and keep my phone close while it slowly connects and spools. I had an inkjet with much further range and quicker response. I have not connected to a computer yet either wirelessly or by cable, so maybe my speed issues are just my phone or the app.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Do You Really NEED an ALL-IN-ONE?
customer_reviews.text: Printer: Crisp and clear, no smudge, and pretty fast. It's a perfect entry-level all-in-one printer. The set-up is really easy. Scanner: Will scan anything and with the Mac, it works with the control panel. The quality is impressive for the price. Before you buy: Do you really need an all-in-one because the scanner feature in this unit WILL NOT WORK if the ink cartridge is empty. If you're dealing with PDF's, on-line real-time editing, and you can swing by the nearest document center to print documents from a USB drive, you MOST PROBABLY will not need this unit if the flatbed document scanner is your real reason to buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Ahmad AR

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting, reliable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because, as a teacher, I frequently need to get things printed out IMMEDIATELY. Brother ink is cheaper by far than the competitors, and this has proven to be a reliable machine after 9 months of almost daily use. The scanner works well, also.
customer_reviews.author: Drue Harris

customer_reviews.title: Smoking HP like a pound of bacon
customer_reviews.text: I'm a self-employed professional computer consultant (for 16 years), and I've recommended HP for 15 years, but since HP pulled the stunt with the 3rd party ink cartridges in 2016, and the stunt with the high maintenance ink usage, I have boycotted HP and switched to Brother, based on consumer reports recommendations, and I am LOVING Brother. I love the quality of the software drivers, and I love the quality of the hardware.
customer_reviews.author: cpu guy

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I got rid of my HP all-in-one printer because it stopped printing and I when I went to reinstall the driver the computer would not run the installation and it produce some nebulous error. Never could get it to reinstall. I bought a brother all-in-one in the past and was very happy with it. So, I set the HP aside and replaced it by the Brother and the driver installation went flawlessly. The print and scan quality of this all-in-one is unbelivably good, particularly when you consider the low prince of the unit.
customer_reviews.author: The Vernier Scale

customer_reviews.title: A very fine all in one for the home
customer_reviews.text: As I bought this for home use, I am give a 5 star rating. I probably will never use the fax, seldom use the copy, and only occasional use the scan as I have a stand alone scanner that is fast/multinational. That said I did want the scan and copy function and am happy with them. I am also happy that I can print from iPhone and iPad. The machine was easy to set up. It has a very compact profile.
customer_reviews.author: Fred S. Judkins II

customer_reviews.title: Not Nearly as Good as Our Last Brother Printer
customer_reviews.text: Our last Brother printer lasted us nearly 8 years before its paper feed broke. Instead of repairing it we decided to buy this one. Since day one this thing has had connectivity issues, issues with the paper tray and issues with toner. It will stop/not even start print jobs all the time due to an error thats not even an error. Opening and closing the paper/toner tray door seems to do the trick, but only for that print job. Sure enough next print job it will act up with more errors. A huge hassle considering the printer is in a different room than the computer. It really is a lousy printer, next time I think we're going with HP.
customer_reviews.author: tdub154420

customer_reviews.title: Poor UI, Never connects, Straight to trash
customer_reviews.text: Installed printer and it worked great.... once. Came back to the machine using Wifi a few hours later and nothing would print. Printer would show as offline. Had to reinstall everything for it work again for 1 single document. A day later, same thing. Got fed up and started using the USB cable for a direct connection. Again, it worked. Once. Left my desktop on for a weekend and sure enough the next week I would get the same "printer offline" error. I won't even go over the frustrating user interface. Or all the software that Brother requires you to install. This thing is just a waste of space.
customer_reviews.author: David Chan

customer_reviews.title: So easy to set up!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, instructions easy to follow. Had to look up how to hook up the phone line through a modem - and the online instructions were so very helpful! I've always been an HP user. I've had several different HP printers - but have to say this one beats everything I've had before. I am so happy I bought it. We publish a newsletter for our community and I've been going to a local printer to have it printed - and though it cost me less than $15 each time, I've finally grown tired of spending the money and taking the time. This printer will do the job nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Augenstein

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set upand reliable
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for 10 months and I have to say I love it. Print quality is great. Has more features than I will ever use (not sure I really needed 2 sided printing). Connected itself to our home network effortlessly. The BIG advantage is how long the toner cartridge lasts and the fact it doesn't dry out and need cleaning after extended periods without use. My only complaint is the LED screen is not bright enough - I have to use a flashlight to read it. Brothers customer service told me to move the printer closer to a window? Fortunately I have not had any other issues requiring customer service. LOL.
customer_reviews.author: Music Man

customer_reviews.title: A PIECE OF JUNK!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product is fools gold. No wonder they put it on sale just to get rid of it on people who don't have much and are looking for a deal. I didn't get to use it 20 times. 7 or 8 months old and warranty and product support expired and scanner gone so it won't function. I tried everything the manual says to fix the problem but will not work. Ultimately the manual says in this case it will need serious repair. Amazon, you hurt us on this one! And BROTHER, ain't no brother of mine. I have avoided your products in the past, and this is my first and last mistake with your company.
customer_reviews.author: ONE TIME

customer_reviews.title: Decent MFC
customer_reviews.text: Brother MFC's used to be garbage. Then something happened and they became reliable and very user friendly. This one is in between. It's the right size for a small office and adequate for moderate printing needs. My issue with it is the wi-fi connectivity. If you shut it off for any reason, it loses its wi-fi settings so you have to reconnect it, input passwords all over again, etc. My old brother printer would remember it no matter how often you turned it on and off. The printer / scanning interface is pretty user friendly and easy to use. Set up was easy. It's a little noisy but not too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Eunephron

customer_reviews.title: Solid unit, but go with the non-fax version unless you need fax
customer_reviews.text: Unit works well. Mobile app to control scan to email is easy to figure out. Print quality is great, and connectivity to WiFi is solid. Toner cartridges last a long time (other than the one in the box). All of that said, unless you need fax, get the Brother DCP-L2550DW. Same unit minus fax. The extra buttons for the fax functions are simply annoying if you don’t need them. Not annoying enough to exchange it, but just makes the display unnecessarily busy with no added value.
customer_reviews.author: Upstate
